info.description: This is Swagger UI environment generated for the TMF Geographic Site Management specification
info.title: GeographicSite Management

name.description: The name that the site is known by

description.description: Text describing additional information  regarding the site

code.description: A code that may be used for some addressing schemes e.g. [ANSI T1.253-1999]

status.description: The condition of the GeographicSite, such as active, inactive, planned

address.description: Used to identify the physical place over the surface of the Earth that is associated to the site based on an entity uniquely identified in the server or providing the geographic address (textual description)  and the geographic location (geometry description) of the physical place. Required if geographicLocation not included

geographicLocation.description: A geo location reference, allows describing through coordinate(s) a point, a line or a space. Required if address not included

calendar.description: A list of calendar period entries indicating the time availability of the site for different periods

relatedParty.description: A list of related party references. A related party defines party or party role linked to a specific entity

@baseType.description: Indicates the base type of the resource for extensibility and polymorphism purposes to differentiate the definition of different type of sites (enterprise, residential, ...)

@type.description: Indicates the type of the resource for extensibility purposes

@schemaLocation.description: A Link to the schema describing this REST Resource

id.description: Unique identifier of the address entity within the server

href.description: Reference of the address entity. An URI used to query the entity resource

streetNr.description: Required if href not included. Number identifying a specific property on a public street. It may be combined with streetNrLast for ranged addresses

streetNrSuffix.description: The street number suffix (or suffix of first number for  aranged address)

streetNrLast.description: Last number in a range of street numbers allocated to a property

streetNrLastSuffix.description: Last street number suffix for a ranged address

streetName.description: Required if href not included. Name of the street or other street type

streetType.description: Required if href not included. Alley, avenue, street, boulevard, brae, crescent, drive, highway, lane, terrace, parade, place, tarn, way, wharf

streetSuffix.description: A modifier denoting a relative direction (E, W, S, N)

postcode.description: Required if href not included. Descriptor for a postal delivery area (also known as zipcode)

locality.description: Required if href not included. An area of defined or undefined boundaries within a local authority or other legislatively defined area, usually rural or semi-rural in nature, or a suburb, a bounded locality within a city, town or shire principally of urban character

city.description: City that the address is in

stateOrProvince.description: Required if href not included. the State or Province that the address is in

country.description: Required if href not included. Country that the address is in

geographicLocation.description: A geo location reference, allows describing through coordinate(s) a point, a line or a space

geographicSubAddress.description: A list of sub addresses. It is used for addressing within a property in an urban area (country properties are often defined differently). It may refer to a building, a building cluster, or a floor of a multistory building.

@type.description: Indicates the type of the resource for extensibility purposes. Here can be UrbanPropertyAddress, FormattedAddress, JapanesePropertyAddress , AustralianPropertyAddress, etc

@schemaLocation.description: A Link to the schema describing this REST Resource. The basic resource describes UrbanPropertyAddress but a schema could be used for other property address description

id.description: Unique identifier of the location entity within the server

href.description: Reference of the location entity. An URI used to query the entity resource

type.description: allows describing Geolocation form: it could be a point, a line, a polygon, a cylinder, etc....

geographicPoint.description: A list of geo points. A GeoPoint defines a geographic point through coordinates

@type.description: Indicates the type of the resource for extensibility purposes

@schemaLocation.description: A Link to the schema describing this REST Resource

id.description: Unique identifier of the sub-address entity within the server

href.description: Reference of the sub-address entity. An URI used to query the entity resource

type.description: type of subAddress. It can be a subunit or a private street.

name.description: Name of the subAddress to identify it with a meaningful identification

subUnitType.description: the type of subunit (e.g.: BERTH, FLAT, PIER, SUITE, SHOP, TOWER, UNIT, WHARF)

subUnitNumber.description: the discriminator used for the subunit often just a simple number (e.g.: 5 for FLAT 5), may also be a range

levelType.description: Describes level types within a building (e.g.: BASEMENT)

levelNumber.description: used where a level type may be repeated (e.g.: BASEMENT 1, BASEMENT 2)

buildingName.description: Allows for buildings that have well-known names

privateStreetName.description: private streets internal to a property (e.g. a university) may have internal names that are not recorded by the land title office

privateStreetNumber.description: Private streets numbers internal to a private street

href.description: Reference of the entity. An URI used to query the entity

@type.description: Indicates the type of the subresource for extensibility/polymorphic purposes. Here can be Individual, Organization, etc

id.description: Unique identifier of the related site entity within the server

href.description: Reference of the related site entity. An URI used to query the related entity

role.description: Role of the related site in the relationship

validFor.description: Validity for the relationship with the related party

status.description: Indication of the availability of the site (e.g.: open)

day.description: Day where the calendar status applies (e.g.: monday, mon-to-fri, weekdays, weekend, all week, ...)

timeZone.description: Indication of the timezone applicable to the calendar information (e.g.: Paris, GMT+1)

hourPeriod.description: Role of the related site in the relationship

startHour.description: The time when the status starts applying

endHour.description: The time when the status ends applying
